Beginnings

It started from reading one conversation on Hackerspace Pomorze slack about taking notes and tools for aggregating them. Someone posted a link to the notion note with a list of knowledge management tools.

It inspired me to dig deeper into this topic. I read two articles about digital gardens: link and link. I got inspired by them even more. Mainly because of a looser approach to presenting the information. Also, I could show the structure of my notes with the graph, because network graphs are cool.

I got inspired, but how about tools? The list that I mentioned earlier could be handy, but my search for tools hasn't ended to this point. I also stumbled upon a collective of gardeners publicly tending their digital notes on the interwebs. I reckoned that I could make my garden in GatsbyJS, in which I have some experience.
